intro: Seguieria votschii, commonly known as the Votsch's seguieria, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its striking blue or violet bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Seguieria votschii is known for its compact growth habit and is often found in forested areas at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
